Own and play America’s foremost Signature Golf Holes without leaving your living room. The tee is open!

54799.name: Know Your Role!
54799.description:
From the back of the book:

This is an OGL-based roleplaying game that thrusts you into the bodyslamming piledriving, high-octane world of sports entertainment. Take on the role of your favorite WWE Superstar or create your own Superstar and commence kicking butt on your quest for championship glory! All you need are a handful of dice, a character sheet, and a few friends who dare to test your ring prowess.
Oh, and better bring some Attitude!

54800.name: The Dragon Reaches of Marakush
54800.description:
From the back cover:

Come and journey through a continent widely different but ultimately the same. A land of high adventure where the world awaits heroes and heroines for the ultimate adventure of a lifetime.

54801.name: Match Makers
54801.description:
Match Makers - an abstract game dripping with theme.

In this two-player card game the competitors try to lead promising couples from first love through engagement to a happy wedding. You will be
- drawing characters from the character deck,
- forming new enamored couples,
- strengthening the relationship of your couples through engagement or marriage and
- seducing your opponent's characters.

Couples that have many common interests are less vulnerable to seduction, but will also earn less points in the final scoring.

Friends of tile laying games will enjoy the hunt for every opportunity to break up opposing twosomes. A good timing of the available actions - combined with swift adaption to the rule changes triggered by the marriage licenses - is the key to success. You can play on the safe side, but should definitely take some risk when your opponent has a limited hand.

More information at http://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/match-makers

54802.name: The Brand X Hero's Guide
54802.description:
The Brand X Hero’s Guide

The rest of the rules tell you how to create a superhero, what your numbers mean, and the rest of that shit. This book gives you some pointers on how to play the damn game.

Consider this a primer on the physics, sociology, and politics of a world with super heroes. This is a world where anything can happen, and, sooner or later, everything does.

Men & Supermen website

54804.name: Monopoly: Here and Now All-Ireland Edition
54804.description: Monopoly Here & Now All-Ireland Edition features the 22 greatest Irish counties as voted by the public (almost 170,000 votes were cast).

54805.name: Yags: Modern
54805.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Modern and futuristic settings tend to use the same sort of rules - combat tends to be focused on firearms, with plenty of 'high tech' skills in the sciences and technical areas.

Modern Characters: Creating characters for Modern and SF campaign settings. Includes new skills and advantages for a modern/future campaign.

Yags Modern: Rules for covering modern and futuristic worlds.

Rules for GDW's Traveller setting are also available, and are basically a specific version of the Modern rules.

Yags website

54806.name: Götter & Dämonen
54806.description:
The expansion "Götter & Dämonen" ("Gods & Demons") focuses on background information about the mystical powers in Aventurien, namely the numerous gods and demons. Also featured are rules that allow players to create and play priests, cultists, summoners and similar professions. And finally details about aventurian cosmology are given.

(User summary)

54807.name: Yags: Traveller
54807.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Yags Traveller is all about designing characters for use in GDW's Traveller background.

The Traveller campaign is huge in scope, covering many thousands of star systems, many different styles of play, spanning many technology levels and can even be set in different periods. Yags Traveller is focussed on games within the Imperium, around the year 1120. It follows the timeline set by GURPS Traveller.

Yags Traveller: Character creation rules for Yags in a Traveller campaign. Also included are skills, techniques and equipment lists.

Yags Traveller Equipment: Equipment lists for Yags Traveller at Tech Level 12.

54808.name: Gaming Frontiers (Volume 5 - 2003)
54808.description:
From the back cover:

"United Playtest does it again with this collection of original content from the best and brightest in the d20 arena. Official new adventures, spells, monsters and magic items direct from the publishers themselves.

Contributing d20 publishers include:

Skeleton Key Games; A Gaming Frontiers exclusive! A complete Orc source book from the people who gave us the critically acclaimed Forsaken of Glimm.

Atlas Games; The good people at Atlas give us not one but Two contributions featuring original content for both Crime and Punishment and En Route 2.

Mongoose Publishing; A peek at Coming of Shadows for the Babylon 5 setting."

and much more.

54809.name: Arcane Lore
54809.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Skills. Specialties. Psychic Powers. Sorcery.

These are the things you’ll find in Arcane Lore, the magical sourcebook for the Gods & Monsters fantasy role-playing game.

Customize your Gods & Monsters character with specialties and skills. Create Exemplars, Alchemists, Bards, and High Races. Fill your wizard’s spell repertoire with Eternal Flame, Ephemeral Backdrop, Sleepfall, Snap Trick, Wraithshape, Ghost Ship, and more. Choose telepathic, psychokinetic, spiritual, corporeal, and dimensional fields for your monk.

All this, and more, in Arcane Lore.

Arcane Lore

54810.name: Divine Lore
54810.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Fill out your prophet’s repertoire of spirits. Command the spirits of Death and Healing, of Chaos and Peace. Channel your faith into the spirit manifestations called Glory Days, Paths of the Dead, Hearthmeld, Bridge of Faith, and many more.

From Christianity to Polynesia, from the Yoruba to the Kari. Four unique perspectives on religion for the Gods & Monsters fantasy role-playing game.

Divine Lore now also includes a sampling of the Alvirel, the Elvish deities of Arlindor.

Divine Lore

54811.name: The Order of the Astronomers
54811.description:
Publisher Blurb:

What kinds of stories happen in a role-playing game? Follow the adventures of Gralen Noslen the sorceror, Sam Stevens the renegade, Will Stratford the mercenary’s son, and the mysterious Charlotte Kordé as they journey south into the unknown. Follow them on their search for knowledge and treasure in a lost castle of a dead order.

And when you’ve read the story, download or buy the rest of the Gods & Monsters books and create your own story with the same adventure!

Order of the Astronomers

54812.name: Endgame
54812.description: Adventure description from the front page: "After a long, exhaustive search you believe you have finally found the key that will lead you to what you need to defeat the Ethers. Unfortunately that path leads back to Tenh, to the hive of the enemy. Tools in hand, you go to put an end to the threat for once and for all. Yet, there are other forces at play in this deadly game, some long forgotten. two-round scenario for characters levels 6-14."

54813.name: The Veggie Patch
54813.description:
From the introduction:

The Veggie Patch is a rather unusual role-playing game. Players aren't powerful wizards, out to discover the secrets of the universe. They aren't highly trained spies, trying to save the world, nor do they fly around the galaxy in a space ship. They aren't even your typical hero, off saving damsels in distress.

Theyʼre vegetables.

No, that isn't a typo. Vegetables. The things that grow in the garden, and that most of us eat on a regular basis. To be fair, these aren't normal vegetables. They are the result of a magical experiment gone wrong. Just like regular people they can think, move, talk and generally get into trouble. Lots of trouble.

54814.name: The Enclave of the United States of America
54814.description:
From the introduction:

We, the citizens of the Enclave, who do believe in the Enclave as the legal continuation of United States of America, rule that we will do everything that our country, its government, or citizens may need to achieve our goal of resurrecting the United States of America once again
-- Constitution of The Enclave, First Paragraph

Enclave expansion is recommended either for high level (12 and above) player characters form the Wastes or can be played from the very beginning (level 1) when using player characters that are Enclave citizen.

You should also be aware that this is a high-tech add-on and it introduces many cyberpunk ideas which can sometimes not fit into your post nuclear world but in my opinion when used in moderation it provides good gaming opportunities.

You have been warned.

54815.name: Revised Arduin: A Primer
54815.description:
User summary:

The Arduin Primer was a small print run pamphlet that was given out for free at the 1984 Grimcon as an introduction to the Battlefactor system of combat resolution that would be published in a forthcoming revision of the Arduin role playing game system.

54816.description:
Jutland Forms provides From 10s for every ship that fought at that momentous battle. Using the latest harmonized game data and organized by squadron and division, it also includes the Jutland scenario extracted from the High Seas Fleet data annex.

Jutland Forms includes a new rules supplement bringing Fear God & Dread Nought more in line withthe harmonized rules standard by replacing chapter eight (damage) and the gunfire modifiers table.

Designed for the loose-leaf format, players can simply replace the old pages with new ones, bringing their rules up to FG&DN 1.1 standard. Jutland Forms is not a complete upgrade, but a quick and easy way to improve these two most important aspects of the game.
54816.name: Fear God & Dread Nought: Jutland Form 10s
boardgamefamily: The First World War at Sea

54817.name: The Devil's Addition
54817.description:
From the back of the book:

Abilene, Kansas
July, 1871
You have just six hours to find a killer among the saloons and brothels of the meanest town on the frontier, armed only with your wits and a percussion Colt revolver. Welcome to the place they call... The Devil's Addition.

Knuckleduster Interactive Western Adventures allow you to determine the direction the story takes. Arrive at one of over 40 endings after choosing your own path through 400 numbered episodes. The action is controlled by your decisions and an occasional roll of the dice. Explore every nook and cranny of frontier Abilene in search of clues which will help you capture a dangerous outlaw who is wanted "dead or alive!" Experience History.

Encounter the sights, sounds, smells and personalities of Abilene's saloon district and the infamous area known as "The Devil's Addition," reconstructed in authentic detail. Play "pistol pool." Learn how the Bull's Head Saloon got its name. Find out what's playing at the Novelty Theatre. Meet a poker playin' preacher. Shoot it out with Texas outlaw John Wesley Hardin. Talk to Wild Bill Hickok and a host of other historical characters that truly brings to life the glory days of Kansas' first big cowtown!

54818.name: Raining Hammers: The Ballad of Johnny MacDonald
54818.description:
From the back of the book:

"MacDonald is a wicked master at the art of depopulation, a vulgar cut-throat, the terror of the Black Range." - Kingston Clipper, August 7, 1883

The authorities branded Johnny MacDonald a murderer, unjustly accusing him of killing his two brothers one stormy night on Sawyer Mountain.

Grab a handful of dice and fight alongside Johnny as he struggles to clear his name and bring justice to the real killers in this interactive tale of greed and revenge in the colorful New Mexico of fact and fable.

54819.name: MotoCaust
54819.description:
From the RoninArts Website:
Philip Reed, popular D20 System PDF author and designer of Steve Jackson Games' Frag, and Christopher Shy, best known for his work on White Wolf's Vampire and Eden Studios' All Flesh Must Be Eaten, present a new and exciting roleplaying game.

The wrung-out Runner leaned over and fixed me with a bloodshot eye. "Listen, man, you don't even know what wasteland is," he said. "I've seen it. I've seen Ground Double Zero."
"Get out," I said, letting the boredom creep into my voice. "No one living's come out of Missouri since the event."
"That's just the legend!" he snapped, pounding a palm on the table for emphasis. My own hand crept toward my pistol, but that seemed to be the end of his outburst. His hand rested where it had landed. It had a perpetual little tremor to it, nerves strung way past the breaking point.
"There's even people, living people, still trying to make a go of it there," he continued. "But the necros ... They've got necros there that would scare the crap out of what we see down here. Then there's the hole"
His voice drifted off. I made a scoffing sound but avoided meeting his eyes. When he mentioned the hole, some unimaginable horror had shone in his eyes. Whatever really spawned that fear, I wanted no share in it.

MotoCaust, a post-apocalypse wasteland filled with zombies, fast cars, and massive guns, is perfect for gamers looking for a little flesh eating and automotive destruction. This 52-page PDF includes:

-- Complete rules for character and vehicle creation and playing the game.
-- An overview of the wasteland, focusing on the area known as Texas.
-- The necros, mutant zombies brought to life by some weird alien spore.
-- Sample vehicles.
-- Front and back covers.
-- And lots of beautiful artwork -- over 20 full-color paintings and almost 20 B&W sketches -- by Christopher Shy.

Plug, the turret man on our tricked-out SUV, swung his piece to fire at the necroworm. The brute was dozens of feet long, snapping down its powerful jaws as it tried to grab the rear-end of our ride. It shrugged off the 20mm rounds.
"Great. Now we've woke up his bee-autch!? Plug snarled as the beast's mate exploded out of the ground to our right. Things were beginning to look grim.

54820.name: Die and Die Again
54820.description:
From the RoninArts Web Site:
How do you bring down an out-of-control juggernaut who doesn't want to stay dead? That's only one of the problems facing the action heroes in this latest release for Extreme Vengeance.

Written by Tony Lee, Die and Die Again is a series of three adventures for use with Extreme Vengeance. Created from scans of the original printing, this 30-page PDF is as the book first appeared way back in 1997.

An adventure trilogy for the #1 Action Movie Game!

54821.name: Dungeon (Issue 157 - Aug 2008)
rpgissuearticle: Save My Game: Let Player's Manage Themselves, Part 1
54821.description:
Cover by Dave Allsop

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

54822.name: Web-Supplement NPCs
54822.description:
User Summary

The Twilight:2013 Web Supplement NPCs is a free collection of 7 PDF files:


NPCs - 10 short character concepts (no stats)
NPCs 2 - 6 statted NPCs
5 PDF files with one statted and detailed NPC (or sample player character) in each:
Edward "Crow" Magnan
Jerry Ohmsdale
Jonathan Simms
Lucas Biermann
Vincent Little Creek

54823.name: Run-n-Gun Basketball
54823.description: Run-n-Gun Basketball is a light basketball card and dice game. Gameplay is streamlined by using mechanics which would keep the game moving at a fast pace. Unlike full-blown basketball tabletop games, players never have to look at charts and statistical data since all the information are found in the individual player cards. A much more simplified and quicker game but still captures the experience of playing the game of basketball wherein scoring, passing, blocking, faking shots, rebounding and stealing balls take place.

54824.name: The Arduin Adventure
54824.description:
Sold as a rulebook or as a boxed set of the same rulebook with character sheets and magic item cards.

From the back cover:

This game is an introduction to the world of adventure gaming, and may be learned in less than an hour by anyone age twelve and older. If you are not afraid of trying something new, you will discover a game that is exciting and different from any game you have tried before.

The Arduin Adventure provides the novice with a set of simple and understandable guidelines for learning the basic concepts of Role Playing. Role-playing is the heart of all adventure gaming systems now on the market. Once learned these concepts allow the player to easily understand them.

The Arduin Adventure has a unique modular learning system that permits the gamer to apply any part of it to another system, or part of another system to itself. Although already a complete game, this system is infinitely expandable with the only limit being the player's imagination. So read on and enter the world of action and adventure. It awaits only your participation to come alive!

54825.name: Radiant Vessel of Thesk
rpgseries: CORE - Living Forgotten Realms Core Adventures
54825.description:
From the front page

Rumours of a great item, touched by divinity, have traveled across Faerûn. Those with an interest in possessing the item and benefiting from its power have sent agents to find it, but no one seems to know what or where it is. A Living Forgotten Realms adventure for characters of levels 1-4.

54826.name: Tales of the Reaching Moon (Issue 8)
54826.description:
Chaos Special

Includes (From contents page)

Secrets of the Chaos Gods
Gods of Terror
Storm Bull Psychology
Men of Storm Bull
Sun County - Writing for RQ
Red Emperor
Coven of Five (part 1)
Broo Society
The Cult of the Crimson Bat
The Spirit Cult of Ulforg
Stony Bones
Gordayan
Jaxarte's Praxian Journal
Live Action Trollball
Zines Seen
Letters
Rent-A-Rogue
Flora Choatica
Devil's Play

54827.name: Ciclos
54827.description:
From the Publisher:

Evolua também!
Estratégia e planejamento são fundamentais para vencer esses emocionante jogo.
Use de estratégia para escolher o melhor momento para evoluir e mudar de CICLO.
1º CICLO:
Ganhe heranças dos terrenos e adquira conhecimento para se formar e escolher uma profissão.
2º CICLO:
Compre terrenos, invista em negócios, acumule dinheiro e patrimônio e se prepare para avançar para o ciclo final.
3º CICLO:
Avance e supere os desafios da VIDA e chegue ao final do ciclo com mais dinheiro e patrimônio e seja o grande vencedor.

Nós da PLAY, temos imensa satisfação de lhe apresentar o mais novo
lançamento de Jogos de Tabuleiro do mercado.

CICLOS é a Evolução dos Jogos Imobiliários e após anos sem
nenhum lançamento original de um Jogo de Tabuleiro, o CICLOS vem para revolucionar e revigorar esse importante nicho de mercado.

Nosso site:
www.playjogosebrinquedos.com.br
www.jogociclos.com.br

Com qualidade impecável, CICLOS não deixa a desejar ao ser comparado aos demais jogos de tabuleiro do mercado.


Roughly can be described as a monopoly-like game divided in 3 cycles (ciclos in Portuguese). On the first you struggle for inheritance and knowledge, struggling to find an career. On the second, you seek to buy land, invest in business, aiming to get money. On the final cycle you aim to overcome the challenges of life and become the richest player.

Translation of the publisher description:

"Evolve!
Strategy and Planning are essential to win this thrilling game.
Choose strategically the best moment to evolve and change to a new CYCLE (cycle = ciclo in portuguese)

1st CYCLE:
Win inheritance of the lands and acquire knowledge to graduate and choose a profession.
2nd CYCLE:
Buy land, invest in business, earn money and wealth and get ready to advance to the final CYCLE
3rd CYCLE:
Advance and overcome the challenges of LIFE and get to the end whit more money and wealth to be the great winner.

(...)

Our site:
www.playjogosebrinquedos.com.br
www.jogociclos.com.br

With flawless quality CICLOS doesn't fall back when compared with the other boardgames currently in market.

(From the translator: please note that this game is being released in Brazil, where the boardgame market consists mainly of "War", a simplified version of "Risk", "Monopoly", "Clue" and "The Game of LIFE". Only recently a few new titles have been released, but, still, the closest we have to modern games were "Hart an der Grenze" (which has been banished from market), "Sultan" (both from Brazilian authors), "Go Bluffing", and a "Diamond" clone, as far as I recall)

54829.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Australian Football League (AFL) version of Monopoly.
54829.name: Monopoly: Australian Football League

54830.name: Challenge (Issue 25)
rpgissuearticle: Ref's Notes: On the Use of NPCs
The Baltic Coast: A Looter's Guide for Twilight: 2000
Twilight Scenario: False Knight on the Road
54830.description:
From the contents page:

Challenge, GDW's magazine of Adventure Gaming is published quarterly, and includes the Journal of the Travellers' Aid Society as an internal section.

From the Journal section contents page:

The date of this issue is 94-1112, or the 94th day of the 1112th year of the Imperium.

Cover artist: William H. Keith
Cover artist for the Journal section: William H. Keith

54831.name: MapTool
rpgissuearticle: Online Gaming with BASH! UE and MapTool
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
54831.description:
[publisher's blurb]

An online, multiuser, networked, graphical, interactive, programmable virtual tabletop.

The jewel in the RPTools crown, don't let the name fool you. MapTool is much more than just a mapping program. Included are not only powerful tools for the creation of detailed maps, but also a chat function, detailed token management (allowing you to track properties of the units placed on the map and display health and status information), and an initiative tracker. Functions not being used can be hidden out of sight. These features enable your computer screen to function as a virtual table top, filling the role of battlemats and dry-erase markers and providing for infinitely scrollable maps and the ability to use a large-screen TV or video projector. It is "game system agnostic", meaning that while MapTool has special support for some game systems (like hexes for GURPS or square templates for D&D 4E) there is no requirement for you to use these features.

[ http://www.rptools.net/ RPTools website]

54832.name: StarCraft
54832.description:
A roleplaying game in the world of StarCraft.
Based on Blizzard's hit computer game.
It is based on Alternity rules, but it's a complete game and does not require any other books to play.
The box includes:
Rules Book
Adventures Book
Gamemaster Screen
Pre-generated characters

54833.description: Originally available as a PDF download from the Repos Productions website as an April Fool Joke, this promo card for Ghost Stories was handed out at GenCon 2009 at the Asmodee booth. Chuck is a 5-red tao Wu Feng incarnation, who kills adjacent ghosts when he comes into play, removes one Qi from each monk in the column in front of him each activation, and provide no reward, other than his signature.
54833.name: Ghost Stories: Chuck No-Rice

54834.name: Galactic Troubleshooters (Issue 001 - Fall 2009)
54834.description:
From Product Description:

Galactic Troubleshooters is designed to be a quarterly game supplement for the X-plorers RPG. It is the one stop for all official game supplementation by Grey Area Games.

Premiere Issue #1 contains: Old School / New Rules: Advanced Combat, Corporate Report: Ra-Industries, Planetary Profile: Lithius-2, Creatures of the Reaches: Creatures of Lithius-2.

Also includes the feature mission, the Fate of the Amun-Re, a complete adventure designed to be played in 1-3 game sessions.

Also available as a PDF

54835.name: Route Z
54835.description:
In Route Z players are trying to get a mini-bus down the road. The bus is escorted by 6 cars. Ahead of them are a horde of zombies, behind them the rumble of zombies on motorcycles. If they can defend the bus long enough, a ritual being cast on the bus will destroy all of the zombies.

Route Z is a cooperative game.

From the game:
"The war was bad. One hell of an understatement, but it was nothing compared to what came next. Zombies. Sure, laugh it up. It’s easy to do when you are surrounded by your friends and not by a horde of putrid cadavers breathing rot down your neck.

If it had just been zombies we would have been fine. What is dead once can be made dead again; but these were puppets of evil humans, or rather, necromancers. They were using found magic to reanimate the thousands fallen during the war. Rumors spread that they had gotten a copy of the true Necronomicon but those were only rumors because we have the only real copy. Now we are fleeing for our lives with it in a battered school bus trying to incant the one spell that will send these blighted things back to whence they came. Our team is ragtag but our vehicles are fast. Hopefully they are fast enough to outrun the necromancers riding double on bikes: that’s right, they taught the damned things to ride Harleys."

Voting for the contest this game is in can be done:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/439899

54836.name: Dungeon (Issue 156 - Jul 2008)
54836.description:
Contents:

Rescue At Rivenroar By David Noonan: A Scales of War Adventure Path adventure. The new Dungeon Adventure Path kicks off in the town of Brindol. The PCs must locate and rescue some missing townsfolk and find out why a new hobgoblin chieftain is so interested in this region. An adventure for 1st-level PCs.

The Haunting of Kincep Mansion By Skip Williams: Long rumored to be haunted by eerie specters, Kincep Mansion has stood for years, mostly untouched by nearby townsfolk. Now something is preying on the local villagers—something that comes from the house. An adventure for 12th-level PCs.

The Last Breaths of Ashenport By Ari Marmell: Newly updated for 4th Edition! The seaside town of Ashenport has a troubled past and a dark secret. If you spend a night in Ashenport, you just might not wake up the next morning. An adventure for 8th-level PCs.

Forgotten Realms® Thunderspire Conversion By Greg Bilsland: If you’re interested in converting Thunderspire Labyrinth to your Realms campaign, look no further than this detailed advice and alternate encounters for H2.

Echoes of Thunderspire Labyrinth By Greg Bilsland: Want more H2 fun? Check out this Side Trek that expands on the action from Thunderspire Labyrinth.

Columns:

Editorial by Chris Youngs, titled: Pitch In!

Dungeoncraft By James Wyatt

Save My Game By Stephen Radney-MacFarland

Map of Mystery By Christopher West

54837.name: Seuche an Bord
54837.description:
Translated from the back of the book:
"Plague aboard
'The Black Rage' is what they call one of the most terrible plagues known on Aventuria. So far only few know of the ship Searider laying on the quay with a sailor aboard infected by the Rage. Only a couple of hours remain before Havena will sink into panic and chaos... the city's safety is in your hands! Will you and your friends find the Searider's other sailors, before the Rage breaks out?
'The Black Rage' is just one of three exciting adventures of this module, containing among other things 10 maps and playable without the Havena box set."

Additional user summary

The other adventures in this module are:
"Auf Dracos Spur" ("On Dracos trail")
The search for runaway pet dog brings the heroes on the trail of Havena's thieves guild where they might discover the secret of a merchant's wealth.

"Das Experiment" ("The Experiment")
A ruthless scientist strives to complete his essay on fear by instilling panic in the entire city. The heroes must stop him before the first victims appear.

54838.name: Tödlicher Wein
54838.description:
Translated from the back of the book:
"Deadly Wine
You know your way around Havena, the sizzling city at the delta of the Great River? Are you at home in its narrow alleys? In this adventure anthology you will meet several astonishing citizens. Leonardo, the ingenious engineer is urgently hiring. The mysterious scientist can be a valuable friend, if you can satisfy his expectations and remain calm in every situation.
'Deadly Wine' is just one of three exciting adventures of this module, containing among other things 10 maps and playable without the Havena box set."

Additional user summary

The adventures in this module are:
"Das Geheimnis des Mechanicus" ("The engineer's secret")
This is the adventure hinted at in the text from the back of the book. The heroes are hired by the mysterious engineer Leonardo to guard his workshop and his newest invention.

"Die Taucherglocke" ("The diving bell")
The heroes are hired by Leonardo again to explore the depth of the river delta.

"Tödlicher Wein" ("Deadly Wine")
A new drug is causing casualties around the city. Now it's up to the heroes to find the dealers and their suppliers.

54839.name: The Compleat Arduin Book 1: Rules
54839.description:
From the back of the book:

The wait is over...

Here is Arduin, the renowned fantasy role-play system, totally revised and reorganized. This volume, the first in the two-volume set, contains the following new and improved features:


Step-by-step character development, with three compleat examples.
A modular format, allowing use of parts of the system with many other popular role-playing systems.
More than two dozen fully-developed character classes.
Twenty distinct character races.
Comprehensive conventions for handling the development of split-class characters.
New, simple and fair rules for awarding experience.
Comprehensive rules for the use of magik.
A compleat description of the Arduin Battle Factor combat system, including all you need to conduct realistic melees.
Over 125 melee and missile weapons, including random critical hit and fumble modifiers.
Over 50 different kinds of armor.
Rules for a variety of firearms, including pistols, rifles, automatic weapons, muzzle-loading cannon, mod era artillery and energy weaponry.
A new, simpler system for sequencing combat.
Price lists for most anything your character might want or need.


and much, much more!

54840.name: White Dwarf (Issue 113 - May 1989)
54840.description:
Games Workshop's monthly games magazine.

Content:
Critical Mass book review
Colleges of Magic for Warhammer Fantasy Battle
Golden Demon Awards
Space Hulk
How to Paint Citadel Miniatures
The Lost and the Dammed
Wandering Monsters
Imperial Guard
Sentinel
'Eavy Metal parts I, II & III

54842.name: White Dwarf (Issue 125 - May 1990)
54842.description:
Games Workshop's monthly games magazine.

Contents:
Games Workshop and Citadel News
Plaque Demon - characters based on the novel
The Dark Beneath the World - Advanced Hero Quest
Chaos Minotaurs - Warhammer Battle
'Eavy Metal parts I & II
Golden Demon programme
Epic Imperial Guard Army List
'Eavy Metal part III
'Eavy Metal - paint and conversion guide
Dead Man's Curve - Dark Future

54843.name: 43 Space Opera Adventure Seeds
54843.description:
Publisher's description:

No matter how good a gamemaster is, sooner or later they’re going to run into a blank when it comes to deciding an adventure for the next session. The great advantage, and sometime the greatest problem, with space opera settings is that the range of adventure possibilities is huge. The sky (indeed, the entire galaxy!) is the limit.

43 Space Opera Adventure Seeds offers just what its name suggests – forty-three different adventure ideas for you to use as a basis for your own scenario. These seeds can be used as-is, combined together with other seeds, or simply used as a springboard for your mind to come up with new and different adventures.

The seeds you will find in this product:

Raising an Army… New Laws… Insect Swarms… Disappearances… Cache of Goodies… Friendly Murder… Communications Blackout… Forgotten Journal… Techno-shock… Ripper’s Back… A New Home… Hargon’s Pirates… Language Barrier… Special Delivery… Short on Gravity… Prophecy of Doom… Like Looking in a Mirror… Assassination… Terrorist Attack… Do I know you?… Fountain of Immortality… Corporate Stalking… That Way Madness Lies… Salvation or Slavery?… Crime Spree… Toxic Sludge… Under the Hill… Hand Made… Sticky Space… Slave Trade… The Test… Fast Food Recipes… Test Flight… Fight Night… Discovering the World… Virtual World… Ship Graveyard… Hidden Messages… Vampires!?!… Studying Rocks… Ghost Ship… The One… Dead Ringer

43 Space Opera Adventure Seeds can be used with any system

54844.name: Mysterious Passenger
54844.description:
Publisher's description:

Mysterious Passenger is a game aid for gamemasters running a space opera style game where the PCs own their own ship, and regularly transport passengers. It provides 6 possible adventure seeds for a "mysterious passenger" who comes on board, but doesn't seem quite right. Some of these seeds can be the entire focus of a session, while others may merely provide a diversion on the trip to make things interesting.

Mysterious Passenger can be used with any system.

54845.name: 15 Space Opera Passengers
54845.description:
Publisher's description:

In space opera settings that allow the PCs to own their own ship, transporting passengers is a common occurrence. But coming up with unique passengers for each trip can be a real drag for the gamemaster – all too often they get relegated to a simple "you find 5 people who want to travel".

15 Space Opera Passengers offers a wide selection of 15 people (or groups of people), each with 5 different stories who are seeking travel on the PCs ship (giving 75 different stories in total). Some of these stories can be the entire focus of a session, while others merely provide a diversion on the trip to make things more interesting.

A few of the passengers seeking travel on the PCs ship include:

* Elderly Couple
* Former Stage Actress
* The Playboy
* Newly-Wed Couple
* A Disruptive Teenager
* The Assassin

15 Space Opera Passengers can be used with any system.

54846.name: 15 Startown Hazards
54846.description:
Publisher's description:

Cities can provide many challenges to a group of characters. Aside from all the normal difficulties that come from dealing with millions of people, at times it can seem like fate itself is trying to cause trouble for the characters while they are in a city.

15 Startown Hazards offers a selection of hazards the characters may face while in a city. While the title refers to a startown (a city built around a starport), the hazards can apply to any city the characters find themselves in. Whether you want a hazard that can slow the characters down in their adventure, be used as a source of a sidequest or even lead on to a full adventure, you are sure to find options here that you can use in your own game.

A few of the hazards the characters may find themselves facing include:

* Falling Danger
* Strike!
* Sports Event
* Swarm of Thieves
* Bomb Threat
* Donations

As an additional aid for the busy gamemaster, 15 Startown Hazards includes tables of suggestions for the names of NPCs, ships, bars, clubs and cities.

15 Startown Hazards is available in two versions – a generic version that can be used with any system, or an EABA specific version (for use with BTRC's EABA system)

54847.name: 15 Starport Encounters
54847.description:
Publisher's description:

In most space opera settings, at some time or another the PCs are going to be passing through a starport. Whether it’s a massive structure that puts today’s modern airports to shame or the futuristic equivalent of a small tin shed on a hill, starports can be a fantastic location for adventures.

15 Starport Encounters offers 15 different encounters that the PCs could find themselves involved in when they next visit a starport. Each encounter has 3 different possible explanations (giving 45 different scenarios in all). You can choose to use one of the explanations as-is, combine several explanations into one, or use them as a springboard for your own ideas. To give each scenario even more flexibility, several complications are suggested that may make the PCs lives even more interesting.

A few of the situations the PCs could find themselves dealing with include:

* Mysterious datastick
* Conspiracy theories
* Long lost friend?
* Woman in need
* An old flame

As an additional aid for the busy gamemaster, 15 Starport Encounters includes several tables of suggestions for NPC names, ship names, bar and club names, as well as shop names for places the PCs may visit.

15 Starport Encounters can be used with any system.

54848.name: Space Opera Passenger Generator
54848.description:
Publisher's Description:

In space opera settings that allow the PCs to own their own ship, transporting passengers is a common occurrence. But coming up with unique passengers for each trip can be a real drag for the gamemaster – all too often they get relegated to a simple "you find 5 people who want to travel".

Space Opera Passenger Generator provides a busy gamemaster with a series of tables allowing you to quickly and easily come up with unique passengers. These tables allow you to generate the details about the passenger, and the reason why they are travelling. Naming passengers is no problem either, with a handy list of 110 names to pick from. Also included are optional "complications" – a quick and easy way to create plots and adventures tied to the passengers.

Three fully detailed passenger groups (with description, travel reasons and complications) are also provided, ready for use in any futuristic campaign.

Space Opera Passenger Generator can be used with any system.

54849.name: Geist: The Sin Eaters
rpghonor: 2010 ENnies - Product of the Year - Nominee
rpgissuearticle: Geist: The Sin-Eaters — One Foot in the Grave
54849.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's a story that begins with death -- with your death.

Why did the Reaper reach out for you before your time? Why was it that you fell between the cracks?

Do you remember the flare of the gun or the sharpness of the knife? Do you remember the gnawing emptiness or the choking thickness of disease? Did you fall across the Threshold alone in the wild, or in the heart of the city?

The story begins there -- with the moment of death, and with the Bargain that reversed it. With the cold hand that brought you back to the living world, with the dry whispers that still haunt you, with the presence that has nestled in your soul.

You've returned to a world where the living cannot see the shades that surround them. You drink rum to the dead, and you eat their remnants and legacies, taking their memories within you. Every night is the carnivale, because every night you walk with ghosts.

Death is a door.

You are the one with the key.

Geist: The Sin-Eaters is the sixth game in the World of Darkness.

54850.name: Dragon (Issue 138 - Oct 1988)
rpgissuearticle: The Black Book and the Hunters
54850.description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XIII, No. 5
Issue #138
October 1988

"Dreadful Tidings: Nothing is so bad at Halloween that it couldn't be much, much worse."

Cover art by Jeff Easley.

54851.name: Broomstix: the Harry Potter RPG
54851.description: An unofficial free RPG based on Harry Potter. No author's description. Uses a d20, but is not "d20 system".

54852.name: Game Master's Shield
54852.description:
From the back of the product:

The game Master's Shield contains all the charts for Chivalry & Sorcery 3rd Edition for easy reference during game play. On the front of the Shield there are tables for Spellcasting and Combat. On the interior of the Shield all the necessary charts are included for Skillscape, as well as damage information for weapons and armor absorption values.

The Shield also acts as a buffer, or screen, allowing the GM's dice rolls and notes to remain private.

Also included is a 16 page booklet with a scenario guide and seven new Magical Devices of Power. The included scenarios will help the Game Master plot adventures and quests. These are outlines that a GM needs only spend a short amount of time fleshing out to create his own unique adventures. The Magic Devices of Power serve as examples of the Chivalry & Sorcery rules for creating magical items, or the GM can use them as is in an existing campaign...

54853.name: EN World Gamer (Issue 3 - Apr 2005)
54853.description:
Contents:

Playing in Another’s World
Finding inspiration in the works of others
by JOSHUA COLE (Art by Jessica L. Jones)

Time Police
A time-travelling d20 mini-game
by MATTHEW J. HANSON (Art by Marlon deRivera)

Totem Druids
A specialist were-druid class
by NICHOLAS J. THALASINOS (Art by Jessica L. Jones)

Power and Purity
Unleashing your character’s inner might
by SHANE O’CONNOR (Art by Jessica L. Jones)

Land Ho!
Discovering New Worlds the Old-fashioned way
by CINDY AND SCOTT MOORE (Art by Juan Navarro)

Fiends of Sin
Evil outsiders that exist to commit the Seven Deadly Sins and to corrupt mortals into the same bad behavior
by MIKE RING (Art by Jessica L. Jones and Nick Pillsbury)

The Adventurer’s Guide to Surviving Anything
Advice on aerial combat, and how to deal with infants, prisoners, & tag-alongs
by PETER M. BALL and RYAN Z. NOCK (Art by Danilo Moretti)

Mythic Earth
DELAWARE’S HEADLESS HORSEMAN
Part of an ongoing series of articles that take real-world folk myths and legends, and provide adventure ideas and mini-settings
by ANDREW HIND (Art by Jessica L. Jones)

54854.name: Off With Their Heads!
54854.description:
In this humorous game set in the world of Lewis Carroll's "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland" and its sequel "Through the Looking-Glass", players attempt to collect the characters from the stories by following the command of the Queen of Hearts: "Off With Their Heads!"

Using a line-up of characters from the stories, players attempt to collect the lead person in line. Bonus points are awarded for collecting certain sets of characters.

Players use action cards to manipulate the line to get the characters they want most.

This game is an homage to / re-implementation of Guillotine.

54855.name: Book of Artifacts
54855.description:
Classic artifacts from the original D&D and AD&D campaigns, along with some that have appeared in supplements or magazines and some that are brand new. Each artifact has a description, history, suggested campaign use, powers, and suggested means of destruction. Additional information is provided on Creating and Recharging magical items.

From the back cover:

"Incredible magic for all campaigns! The Book of Artifacts will help very adventure reach new plateaus of mystery, danger, and epic excitement. Within these pages is the most complete collection of legendary and obscure artifacts ever assembled for the AD&D 2nd Edition game."

54856.name: Just One Die Soccer
54856.description:
Just One Die Soccer is a solitaire statistical, replay-oriented game on Soccer.
It is based on the comparison between the goal for and against for the two teams involved in the match, with several additional options (as random period of form, etc.).
After a few simple calculations, each game is resolved with a single die roll: so it is possible to replay a season in one sitting.
Basic game comes with rulebook, charts, Italian Serie A 200/2009, Swiss Superleague 2008/2009 and Austrian Bundesliga 2008/2009. More seasons and leagues soon to come.
Available directly from the designer (send an email to pumaye@virgilio.it or pumaye@gmail.com)
Also available through wargamedownloads.com

54857.name: Claustrophobia
54857.description: Claustrophobia is a fast-play rules system for science fiction corridor fights. It can be used with any miniatures and board sections and accommodates small and large groups.

54858.name: Dungeon (Issue 155 - Jun 2008)
rpgissuearticle: Keep on the Shadowfell: Eberron® Conversion
Keep on the Shadowfell: Forgotten Realms® Conversion
Sleeper in the Tomb of Dreams
54858.description:
Contents:

Keep on the Shadowfell: Forgotten Realms® Conversion By Greg Bilsland: Itching to start your first 4th Edition Forgotten Realms campaign? Wait no further! This article not only shows you where the Keep on the Shadowfell is in the Realms, but includes alternate plot information and bonus encounters.

Keep on the Shadowfell: Eberron® Conversion By Stephen Radney-MacFarland: If you’re an Eberron fan, you don’t have to wait to start your new campaign. Use H1: Keep on the Shadowfell to kick off your first 4th Edition campaign now!

Heathen By Scott Fitzgerald Gray: The paladin Jaryd set out to find
and destroy the Hand of Naarash. He was never heard from again. Now the PCs must retrace Jaryn’s steps across the harsh wilderness and determine what has become of the noble warrior. An adventure for 4th-level PCs.

Sleeper in the Tomb of Dreams By Matthew Sernett: Cultists seek to free the soul of a terrible entity from beyond the stars. The PCs must retrieve the soul vessel of a long-dead evil paladin to stop cultists’ plan from coming to fruition. An adventure for 8th-level PCs.

Side Trek: Shadow of Kalarel By Peter Schaefer: If your PCs aren’t ready for H2 after finishing Keep on the Shadowfell, or if you just haven’t had enough of Kalarel, these extra encounters can add extra depth to any H1 experience.

Columns:

Editorial by Chris Youngs, titled: The Coup de Grace

Save my Game By Stephen Radney-MacFarland

Dungeoncraft By James Wyatt

Map of Mystery By Christopher West

54859.description:
A simple strategic level game for 1-4 players, simulating the struggle for dominance between Carthaginians, Romans, Macedonians and Persians/Parthians. It can be played as it is with very simple combat rules, or individual abttles could be played with miniature figures using your preferred rule set. The impact of Alexander, Hannibal and Scipio is emphasised.

This game was the Society of Ancients' early membership incentive game for 2009 and came with their magazine Slingshot in August 09, but is also available separately.
54859.name: Empire: The Macedonian  Punic Wars, 350-150BC

54860.name: Dragon (Issue 375 - May 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Confessions of a Full-Time Wizard - Bear With Me, Part 2
Domain of Dread - Graefmotte, The Font of Sorrows
RPGA Report - Summer Events Heat Up with New Content!

54861.name: Metropolis Sourcebook
54861.description:
From the back of the book:
The Metropolis Sourcebook contains the essential information you need to know about the City of Tomorrow and the people who walk its streets.
Inside you will find:

Descriptions of some of the city's most notable locations and organizations.
Details on over 100 heroes, villains, and ordinary people of the city.
New and optional rules and powers.
Advanced equipment creation rules, including an armory of some of the most sophisticated powered armor seen in the city.
Tips on designing a super-heroic city.
A Mxyzptlk-ed-up adventure with a Fifth Dimensional twist on toy crazes.

54862.name: The Isis Coordinates
54862.description:
An Adventure for use with Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game

From the back of the book;

An Imperial Survey Corps vessel emerges from hyperspace above an uncharted planet. The survey team begins its sensor sweeps. The lifeforms indicator crackles to life. Habitations are scanned ... a spaceport ... power generators ... landspeeders ... an X-wing fighter ... Rebels!

The survey team has stumbled upon a densely-populated Alliance factory world. If they live to reach an Imperial base and report their findings, hundreds of thousands of lives are at Peril, and the Alliance will lose 30 percent of its starfighter manufacturing capacity. Only two things stand between the Imperials and their base - half a galaxy of hyperspace, and a small band of Rebel heroes!

54863.name: Warlock (Issue 9 - Apr/May 1986)
rpg: Fighting Fantasy: The Introductory Role-Playing Game

54864.name: Player's Guide to Tapani
54864.description:
from the back of the book;

Tapani sector is the home of the rich and dangerous —-- of mighty lords, Imperial diplomats, and powerful Mining Guild officials. The big boys don't play nice, and what you don't know can hurt you. If you're going to be spending time in Tapani sector, you need to know the ins and outs of dealing with the Tapani nobility, and where to be seen when capital season rolls around. Learn when a Herglic merchant is insulting you, and where the best music festivals in the Freeworlds can be found. Most importantly, know which noble houses you can work with, and which ones are most likely to stab you in the back.

The Player's Guide to Tapani gives you this sort of information. It also provides everything you need to create characters thoroughly grounded in the sector: a gazetteer of major homeworlds, essays on the aliens common to the sector (and how they're treated by the humans), and a Heroes and Rogues-style character generation system which gives your character a history and background. Still want more? How about over 30 all-new character templates tailored for play in Tapani sector?

54865.name: The Best of White Dwarf Articles (Volume II)
rpgissuearticle: A Spellcaster's Guide to Arcane Power
An Introduction to Dungeons & Dragons: 2 - Dungeon Mastering Styles
An Introduction to Dungeons & Dragons: 3 - The Spell-Using Classes
An Introduction to Dungeons & Dragons: 4 - Fighters and Thieves
An Introduction to Dungeons & Dragons: 5 - Characterisation and Alignment
How to Lose Hit Points...and Survive
The Best of Starbase: The Mudskipper
The Best of Starbase: The Ship's Library
The Best of Starbase: Traveller Campaigns
The Best of Treasure Chest - Amulets & Talismans
The Best of Treasure Chest: Magic Items
The Best of Treasure Chest: Spells
The Dungeon Architect: The Constructed Dungeon
The Dungeon Architect: The Interesting Dungeon
The Dungeon Architect: The Populated Dungeon
What Makes A Good AD&D Character Class
54865.description:
Selected material from White Dwarfs 15 to 30, including An Introduction to D&D, The Dungeon Architect and Backdrop of Stars.

Contents:

Introduction to Dungeons & Dragons, Parts I-V by Lew Pulsipher
How to get the most from your game

Conversion by Roger Musson
A Clerical ability

Backdrop of Stars by Andy Slack
Fleshing out the Traveller campaign

Dungeons & ... Dragoons by Phil Masters
Historical troop types in FRP

Starbase by Bob McWilliams
Traveller Campaigns

Treasure Chest by Lewis Pulsipher
Amulets & Talismans

A Spell Caster's Guide to Arcane Power by Bob Milne
A spell point system for D&D

Star Patrol by Andy Slack
Expanded scouts in Traveller

The Dungeon Architect, Parts 1-3 by Roger Musson
How to construct credible dungeons

Starbase
The Ship's Library

Treasure Chest
Spells

How to Lose Hit Points and Survive by Roger Musson
Survival for D&D characters

AD&D Character Classes by Lew Pulsipher
Developing a balanced class

The Self-Made Traveller by Trevor Graver
Alternate prior experience system

Fiend Factory
The Top Ten monsters

Starbase
The Mudskipper

Treasure Chest
Magic Items

The Detective by Marcus L Rowland
New D&D character class

54867.name: Kidnapped
54867.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Ruthless kidnappers have abducted the eight-year-old son of Reverend Judge Hykros Allumen, Ravens Bluff's reigning high priest of Tyr. You have been entrusted with the task of delivering the ransom--500,000 gp worth of platinum, magic, and jewels. Can you see it safely past all the greedy bandits trying to intercept you and take the treasure for themselves? And if you do, can you trust the kidnappers to return the stolen child? A tale of trust, betrayal, and revenge.

This classic tournament has been revised for use with the new City of Ravens Bluff sourcebook. It is adaptable for use in any low-level, mid-level, or high-level campaign.

54868.name: Shilukar's Lair
54868.description:
From the front cover:
Deep underground, below the Guildsman District, the dark elf Shilukar has claimed a section of tunnels and chambers that were once a part of Ghul’s Labyrinth. Here, he has built his chaositech laboratory and keeps his weird creations. Ptolus Adventure Maps: Shilukar’s Lair contains 15 miniatures-scale map tiles designed for use with the third level adventure Shilukar’s Lair found in chapter 33 of Ptolus: Monte Cook's City by the Spire. These tiles will add a new dimension to an evening of table top dungeon delving action.

rpgitemversion: Das Unterreich - Ein Handbuch von Drizzt Do'Urden
54869.name: Drizzt Do'Urden's Guide to the Underdark
54869.description:
From the Back of the Book:
The place has many names: the Underdark, Deepearth, the Realms Below, the Night Below, the Lightless Lands. This vast world beneath the surface is home to fabled races such as beholders, cloakers, drow, illithids, and ixzan. Menzoberranzan, the dreaded City of Spiders, is only one of the hidden cities of the Underdark.

This 128-page book, compiled by the Underdark's most famous son, Drizzt Do'Urden, lays bare the bizarre societies that lurk in the Realms Below. It includes an overview of the major races of the Underdark, and Underdark survival guide, and details and maps of more than a dozen cities. Discover a drow city constructed entirely of calcified spider silk, a nigh-immortal dwarven king trapped in stone form, and a storehouse of knowledge that rivals Candlekeep. Learn the particulars of the alliance between Manshoon and the beholders of the Anaurian Hive, the ambitions of the true master of Firedrake Bay, and an explanation of the enduring strength of the beholder cults along the Lake of Steam.

With Drizzt Do'Urden as your guide, a whole new world opens up beneath your feet.

Suitable for all levels of play.

54872.name: Dire Tombs
54872.description:
From the Back of the Cover:
Your tabletop never looked better! With DUNGEONS & DRAGONS miniatures and this pack of customizable dungeon tiles, you can add a new dimension to your D&D adventures. Easy to set up and infinitely expandable, this pack allows you to create the dungeons and adventures you want to play. Pick up additional packs to create larger, more elaborate dungeons!

This pack contains six durable, fully illustrated map grids, featuring haunted tombs, lost temples, web-filled catacombs, and other terrain elements that you can use to make great D&D encounters that enhance your roleplaying game experience.

54874.description:
A chess-style game with 20 pieces per side, secret / variable set-up. 2 players, ages 8 and up. Print-n-play.

Standard chessboard
40 pieces

Based on E. R. Burroughs' Chessmen of Mars' (Jetan). I made a set of the original game Burroughs used as a plot device for the book and quickly discovered the design was flawed - 99% of all games ended in a draw. Not much fun. As I changed and clarified the rules to make the game competitive and fun, I soon hit upon the idea of dropping the specialized board and introducing secret set-up.

No longer using the 10x10 square board, EAGLES & KINGS uses a standard chessboard. With 20 pieces per side, this leaves 4 pieces in the third rank. Set-up for each player is done in secret. This makes each game potentially unique, as each player can place any of his pieces anywhere within the first 3 ranks.

Everything needed to play EAGLES & KINGS can be found in the files section, and permission is given by the designer for print-n-play. The piece designs and rules are my own and copyrighted.
54874.name: Eagles & Kings

54875.name: Caves of Shadow
54875.description:
User Summary:
Billed as a "Free Game", this booklet was distributed to game stores as a promotion for the Dungeons & Dragons Adventure Game starter set (2000).

From the Back of the Book:
The Caves of Shadow game is only the beginning. In the DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Adventure Game, your heroes will carry more spells and magical weapons into battle against villainous creatures. The only limitations of the game is your imagination.

For 3 or more players, age 13 and up.

54876.name: Against the Giants: The Liberation of Geoff
54876.description:
From the back cover:

"A decade ago, the land of Geoff was overrun by a horde of giants, ogres, and evil humanoids, its people either slain, enslaved, or driven into exile. Now at last the tide has turned. The time to free the people of Geoff from their servitude to the giantish tyrants has come! But don't forget to watch your step when you confront the true masters behind the giant clans!

Contains the full text of three classic adventures by Gary Gygax:

G1 Steading of the Hill Giant Chief
G2 The Glacial Rift of the Frost Giant Jarl
G3 Hall of the Fire Giant King




Details eighteen new encounter sites in the war-torn land of Geoff, linked together to form a grand campaign.

Provides dozens of hours of gameplay as the heroes struggle to free an entire country from the grasp of giant overlords."

54877.name: Midnight at the Well of Souls
rpg: Midnight at the Well of Souls
54877.description:
aka "Midnight at the Well of Souls Role-Playing System"

From the back of the box:

"Entered by a thousand gateways built by a race lost in the clouds of time[,] the planet its dwellers called the Well World turned beings of every kind into something else ...

"Journey to the Well World or adventure in the domains of the Com Worlds. Either way, this fast-paced science fiction role-playing game will fascinate you and your friends for hours"

Based on the books by Jack L. Chalker

54879.name: Flaws and Merits
54879.description:
From the book introduction:

While game mechanics allow you to navigate through dangers, slice up monsters, and provide a basis for interacting with society and the environment, many more elements separate a character from a sheet of statistics. Flaws and Merits provides a foundation where the statistics collide with role-play allowing you to develop idiosyncrasies to help further define the distinguishing traits of your character.

54880.description:
5 different 2-player strategy games in one box.

In the box a 2 sided gaming board: one is a classic checkers 8x8 grid, the other is 9x9 grid with some fields randomly seperated with red lines (which do play a role in the Colix game).

The included games are:

Okta - 8 different pieces numbered from 1 to 8 have to be put together to a tower with the pieces increasing, so the 8 in the bottom and the 1 at the top. Pieces only move vertically or horizontally. 4 of the own pieces (the un-even numbers) start at the opposite side of the gaming board.

Super Okta - The same as Okta, but you play on the 9x9 side of the gaming board.

Uno - A kind of checkers variant, where the pieces are homogenically placed on the gaming board. Winner is the player who first eliminates his own pieces. Pieces move vertically and horizontally and are taken by moving over the own pieces diagonally.

Slalom - Small pieces have to be put in a way that they can be taken in 8 strokes by a bigger piece.

Colix - You play on the 9x9 side of the gaming board and the red lines can´t be crossed. Every player controls 3 colors (6 pieces of each color). Aim of the game is to eliminate one color of the 3 colors of the other player.
54880.name: Fünf neuartige Taktikspiele

54881.name: The Compleat Arduin Book 2: Resources
54881.description:
From the back cover:

The wait is over...
Here is Arduin, the renowned fantasy role-play system, totally revised and reorganized. This volume, the second in the two-volume set, contains the following new and improved features:


Over 100 unique treasures, and the tools to create many more.
More than 200 monsters, including all the old favorites and lots of brand-new horrors.
Special sections devoted to dragons, giants, the realm of Faerie, shapechangers, undead and demonkind.
More than 400 of the most powerful magiks ever writ.
Separate magiks for rune weavers, druids, alchemists, illusionists and herbalists.
A separate spellfinder, with over a thousand entries.
Compleat rules for healing, regeneration, resurrection, resuscitation, and curing of disease.
Comprehensive rules for weather.
Rules for hell spirals, whimsy and dancing weapons.
A new, simpler method of generating encounters with NPC parties of any race.
Examples for the GM on how to set up and run an encounter.
Tables for ceiling, floor and wall traps.
An index covering Books I and II.


And much, much more!

54883.name: Escalera
54883.description:
This game is played using a 50-card deck (naipes estilo español), with 4 suits: gold, swords, clubs, and cups (oro, espada, basto, y copa). It could be played using all cards except the king in a regular deck, with the ace as 1, and using diamonds as gold.

The player with the 7 of gold plays first. Players take turns (moving clockwise around the table) placing cards. You can play a card one up or one down from any cards currently on the table (played on the 7 but leaving all cards visible), or you can play a 7 from a different suit to start another escalera (staircase) in a new pile. If you can play, you must, otherwise you pass.

The object of the game is to play all of your cards. At the end of each game, players with cards left in their hands receive 1 point per card. When a player receives 15 points, that player is out of the game. Once it is down to 2 players, the player with the fewest points wins (as the game is no fun with only 2 players, since you know what cards the opponent has).

54884.name: Arkham Sanitarium
54884.description:
From the inside cover:

While combating the forces of the mythos, investigators are often exposed to hideous horror and blasphemous secrets that drive them into the embrace of insanity. If they continue on their perilous path, the may eventually be defeated either through total insanity or death. In either case, they generate a large paper trail which others can follow. An admission form to a local sanitarium can spark an investigation into the life of a deceased inmate, and lead the seeker into realms of unearthly evil. This supplement is meant to aid the keeper in the creation of such clues for the investigator. Forms include a death certificate (good for any death that occurs in Massachusetts), a psychological profile, a police fingerprint form (for when the investigators run afoul of the law), and even a few singularly suggestive ink blots. These documents are all centered around Arkham Sanitarium and the related businesses and institutions in the small town of Arkham, Massachusetts.

54886.name: Traitor's Road
54886.description: Adventure description from the front page: "A lady in distress, but a diplomat, not a damsel. In the machinations of the great, the good and the not-so good, appearances are not all that deceive."

54889.name: Macross II: Spacecraft and Deck Plans - Volume Two
rpgseries: Macross II Spacecraft and Deck Plans
54889.description:
Second of three "Deck Plans" Sourcebooks to use with the Macross II RPG universe.

Deck Plan 2 features deck plans, layouts, and cutways for UN Spacy Corvette, Battleship, and Command Carrier, Zentraedi Flagship and Carrier, and Marduk Scout Ship, Dreadnaught and Destroyer.

Also includes a short scenario.

54890.name: Macross II: Spacecraft and Deck Plans - Volume Three
rpgseries: Macross II Spacecraft and Deck Plans
54890.description:
The third and final Deck Plans source book for Macross II contains deck plans for the SDF-1 Macross and ARMD platforms.

The bulk of this sourcebook contains the entire map of the SDF-1 Macross, including the self-contained city inside this massive vessel.

54891.name: Brotherhood of Steel Sourcebook
54891.description:
From the introduction:

This document is intended as a source of information for players who are including the brotherhood in their campaign, or are playing brotherhood characters.

Much of the information in this document is totally unofficial and original, due to a lack of good official information about the brotherhood, and you may not agree with everything in this document (in which case you are of course free to change it to your hearts content). I do however think that where I have added new material, that it strengthens the atmosphere of the brotherhood, rather than detracting from it.

You will need a copy of the Fallout PnP rulebook by Jason Mical to play.

54892.name: Waterworld Campaign Sourcebook
54892.description:
[Introduction]

Waterworld is a campaign setting designed to work with the Fallout Pencil and Paper Roleplaying Game system by Jason Mical, adapted from the computer-based SPECIAL system designed by Interplay.

Although it uses the same system (with some slight modifications), the setting isn't anywhere near the familiar, Interplay-created "retro-future" of the computer games, or the original core rules - so forget places like Vault City and the Great Wastes.

In fact, the Waterworld "world" is a different Earth altogether; if you have to rationalize it and work it in with "canon" Fallout locations, just think
that Waterworld is on an Earth in one of an infinite number of parallel dimensions.


Waterworld takes place in the distant future: at least the year 3100 AD, if not farther. Global warming, and perhaps other factors like a nuclear war, have melted the Earth's icecaps.

The entire planet is one vast ocean, unending and harsh. Humanity managed to survive, but exists in small, isolated communities that dot the surface of the planet. The oceans are populated with strange, new creatures, the product of evolution's encouraging hand - natural or otherwise.

54893.name: Fallout Vault City Sourcebook
54893.description:
[developer's notes]

This Document consists of a few parts, first is an Introduction by Intelligence Department of the Brotherhood of steel, next is the “Handbook” given to vault dwellers when they first entered the vault, it is a source on general vault life, and is suitable to any campaign where contact with a vault is incurred.

Next is the History of Vault City, from the events that lead to the vault, to just after the Chosen one in Fallout 2’s visit. Like Fallout 2, references to the actual person are limited. If your playing an earlier campaign ignore those parts that occur some time after.
Then the Constitution of Vault City, while some will skip over this, and I understand why, this is a great role playing resource, allowing you to understand the Structure of Vault politics, and how they operate.
Special Characters then make an appearance, from Emerson the First First Citizen, to Lynette, the current First Citizen, and many people in between, followed by Archtypes and details on playing a citizen from any vault (with special notes for Vault City)

54894.name: Palladium RPG Book 8: The Western Empire
rpgissuearticle: Palladium Fantasy RPG Hook, Line, & Sinkers for the Western Empire
54894.description:
From the back cover:

An in-depth look at the nefarious "Empire of Sin", the Western Empire! The young bold Emperor Itomas, the Empires hierarchy, key nobles, cities and provinces, habits, allies, and society. And a glimpse at the brewing political intrigue and wars."


An overview of the Western Empire today, plus important moments in its past and its plans for the future.
Western society, trouble spots, rebellion and war.
Key political figures including Emperor Itomas and The Slayer of Mountains.
New herbs, poisons and drugs.
New Magic items.
Adventures and adventure ideas.
Over 200 pages.

54895.description: An enjoyable educational game, designed to encourage development of basic skills in young children. Contains 6 cards with 12 activities/games, from the fantastic world of Looney Tunes. Using the Magic Pen, Children can answer more than 150 questions ranging from Logic to Attention, Observation, Memory, Form, Colours, Quantities and Combinations. The electronic pen highlights every correct answer with a happy tune and coloured lights.
54895.name: E-Lektor Quiz

54896.name: Palladium RPG Book 9: The Baalgor Wastelands
54896.description:
From the back cover:

An in-depth look at the Baalgor Wastelands, notable tribes, clans, key leaders, cities and world information. And a glimpse into the past and at the legendary Elf-Dwarf War.


New R.C.C.'s including the monstrous Baalizad, mischievous Quillback, Gosai assassins, Quorians and others. Plus more on the Gromek, Eandoroth, True Giants and mysterious Minotaur.
New monsters like the Earthshaker, Sandwyrm, Mogoloth and others, plus wilderness encounter tables that also offer adventure ideas.
Ancient ruins, forgotten catacombs, and the promise of lost treasures.
Ancient artifacts, magic and mysteries.
The giants' mountain city of Ghurthasi Tor.
The bandit city of Troker.
The Gromek-Giants war!
Tons of adventure ideas and Hook, Line & Sinkers.
World information and maps. Over 200 pages.


Epic fantasy adventure and intrigue - Palladium style!

54897.description: The Umenzi Tribesmen is the sixth faction for Battleground: Fantasy Warfare, the award-winning tabletop wargame in which cards, rather than expensive miniatures, represent your forces. The Umenzi Tribesmen draws inspiration from the great Zulu armies of earth as well as a cinematic take on Voodoo, adding a new level of magic to Battleground play. As with previous Battleground factions, the Umenzi Tribesmen is packaged in two decks. Starter decks include all the cards needed to play -- 18 units, the 30-card Command deck and two reference cards -- plus the basic rules. Reinforcement decks include 50 unit cards, including two types not found in the Starter, plus the advanced rules.
54897.name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Umenzi Tribesmen Reinforcements

54898.name: Dragon (Issue 137 - Sep 1988)
rpgissuearticle: Up and Running in the Land of Mutants
54898.description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XIII, No. 4
Issue #137
September 1988

"Wilderness Adventures: In case you really want to know what's around the next bend."

Cover art by Keith Parkinson.

54899.name: Dragon (Issue 130 - Feb 1988)
rpgissuearticle: Arcane Lore: Magic from East to West
Dungeon Etiquette: What to do when your wizard falls asleep, or "You're dead. Shut up!"
Get the Most From Your Magic: Spell-casting advice for magic-users of all levels
Hold On to Your Illusions!: Keeping illusions (and illusionists) in balance
If Looks Could Kill: Looking gaze weapons right in the eye
Keeping a Good Watch: Wind these watches with care!
The Dragon's Bestiary: An unusual plant for the GAMMA WORLD game
The Faces of Magic: Magical disguises for wary wizards
The Game Wizards: Cosmic flux and second-edition magic
The Oriental Sea: The high seas of the Oriental Adventures world
The Role of Computers - The champions: Wizardry IV & Phantasie III
54899.description:
Vol. XII No. 9 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art: One of the things about being a magic-user, as cover artist Linda Medley shows, is that you never have to worry about not having anyone to talk to. The lady's froggie familiar seems to think differently about the matter, though - but that's a frog for you. (from the contents page)

This issue featured The Arcane Arts: Without Merlin, where would Arthur have been? - 5 articles for magic-users.

It also listed the "Gamers' Guide," which was an index of all the advertising in the issue.

54900.name: Palladium RPG Book 10: Mount Nimro: Kingdom of Giants
54900.description:
From the back cover:

An in-depth look at the fledgling Kingdom of Giants, notable Chieftains, key leaders, clans, strongholds, political structure and unrest, and world information.


New R.C.C.s including the Conjurer, Gigante Warlord, and Blade Priest.
Ancient ruins, forgotten magic and the promise of lost rune weapons.
The Kingdom of Giants described and outlined.
Political intrigue and conspiracies.
More on the Gromek-Giants war.
A full adventure plus adventure ideas, subplots, and Hook, Line & Sinkers.
World information and maps.
160 pages


High fantasy compatible with the entire Palladium Megaverse!

54902.name: The Queen of Air and Darkness
54902.description: The Queen of Air and Darkness is the third adventure in the Dawn of Defiance campaign, which will take heroes from 1st level all the way through 20th level in a continuous storyline designed to give both players and Gamemasters a complete Star Wars Roleplaying Game Saga Edition experience. This adventure lets the players take part in the famous Cloud City Sabacc Tournament (the same tournament in which, years later, Han Solo will win the Millennium Falcon from Lando Calrissian) and the heroes should advance to 7th level by the end of the adventure. Over the course of this adventure, the heroes will discover that there is more to this tournament than is apparent on the surface, and that it is being used to cover a transaction between Darga the Hutt and the evil Galactic Empire. This adventure is the final part of the story arc that makes up the first chapter in the Dawn of Defiance campaign. After the adventure, the heroes should have some much-needed downtime. (From Adventure Introduction)

54903.name: Palladium RPG Book 13: Northern Hinterlands
54903.description:
From the back cover:

The Northern Hinterlands, a forgotten and misunderstood land of adventure, magic and long winters. A land of forgotten history and misanthropes. Its many secrets and challenges are sought by thousands, but few ever return to tell the tale. Those who do are considered some of the greatest heroes to walk the planet. And the lucky ones return with treasure or magic beyond their wildest dreams.


The mysterious Northern Hinterlands mapped and described.
Bizantium's colonies of the shadow coast.
Ophid's Grasslands and the Hinterland forests.
The people and places of Kiridin.
Forgotten people, lost treasure, and magic.
The "long winter". Cold rules and travel.
New monsters, O.C.C.s and R.C.C.s.
Adventure ideas, settings and maps.
A glimpse at The Defilers and the Palladium of Desires. Just two of the Hinterlands' legends and secrets.
192 pages by Coffin and Siembieda.


High fantasy compatible with the entire Palladium Megaverse!

54904.name: Palladium RPG Book 14: Chaos Lands
54904.description:
From the back cover:

The legendary Land of the Damned is said to have been created by the Gods of Light to lock away from the world the Minions of Darkness that once served the Old Ones.

The Northern Mountains are the first obstacle one must brave to gain entry - higher than Earth's tallest mountains, plagued by monsters and demons, and littered with the bones of those who have failed. Beyond the mountains is the Great Rift and the Land of the Damned. A place of mystery and evil, but also of the promise of secrets of magic, forgotten history and great treasure. Join us, if you dare, to explore this cursed realm.


The Northern Mountains and their many legends, mysteries and dangers.
The Great Rift that divides the Land of the Damned and leads to the pits of Hades.
The Tristine Chronicles and history of the region.
Over a dozen new monsters (and some old favorites too).
Over a dozen new infernal supernatural fiends.
Over 200 adventure hooks and ideas drawn from the Tall Tales, Rumors & Lies Tables, Worlds of the Abyss Table, and regional descriptions and historical background!!
'Nuff said!
192 pages by Bill Coffin.


High fantasy compatible with the entire Palladium Megaverse!

54905.name: The City of Burden's Peak
54905.description:
From the back of the book:

Sitting proudly, like an unfound jewel in the middle of a dark world, is the bustling city of Burden's Peak. This Point-of-Light setting for use with the Dungeons & Dragons 4th Edition rules is a complete adventuring accessory. Entire campaigns can be played within Burden's Peak towering walls. Guilds can be joined, shops can be visited, and the vast, mysterious underground of the city can be explored. Complete with new monsters, full-color maps, and fully-realized NPCs, Burden's Peak is the perfect city-based setting for the new edition of Dungeons & Dragons.

In the future, look for exciting expansions for Burden's Peak, including the entire layout and description for the dark, labyrinth-like Undermaze and detailed descriptions of the city's outside surroundings. Towering mountains, deep forests, foul swamps, and rolling plains encircle the secluded city, posing as a secure barrier to outside invasions, but harboring enough dangerous enemies to be a powerful threat by themselves.

54906.name: The Dungeonsweeper's Guild
54906.description:
From the back of the book:

The Dungeonsweepers: one of the most influential guilds in all of Burden’s Peak. Many strive to gain the title of Dungeonsweeper, but very few succeed. Those that do gain more than just membership into a guild; they gain a title of honor, dignity, pride, and service to Duke and city. They are seen by the residents of Burden’s Peak as protectors, watchers, and confidants. Since the birth of the mighty city, the Dungeonsweepers have been there; ready to lay down their lives in defense of Burden’s Peak and the thousands of residents that call it home.

This sourcebook is an expansion to the City of Burden’s Peak city guide. Contained here is an entire history of the famed guild, the guild-masters that that have made the Dungeonsweepers famous, and some of the many accomplishments they have to their well-known name.

Also inside are adventures based around the Dungeonsweepers. Whether
your PCs are hopefuls looking to sign on in the famous guild, or already established members, this sourcebook brings to life the mighty guild and gives your PCs a chance to become part of its legacy.

For use with these 4th Edition Dungeons & Dragons core products:
Player’s Handbook
Dungeon Master’s Guide
D&D Miniatures
D&D Dungeon Tiles

As well as this 3rd party product:
The City of Burden’s Peak supplement

54909.name: Das Bornland
54909.description:
Translated from the back of the book:

"The Bornland
The Bornland is a realm of opposites: serfs with no rights are among its residents just as fur hunters, rangers, rich merchants and nobles. The landscape is distinguished by endless forests and vast swamps haunted by wild and uncanny creatures, while the capital Festum is one of the most magnificent ports of Aventuria. This first volume of the series "Regions of Aventuria" describes the fabled Bornland in comprehensive detail. A seperate chapter for the gamemaster offers background information and reveals several secrets that can be the basis for many adventures.

Contents:
- travel guide through the Bornland
- secrets of the Bornland
- Coloured map of the city Festum
- Coloured map of the city Rodebrandt
- black/white map of the land"

54910.name: Dragon (Issue 374 - Apr 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Confessions of a Full-Time Wizard - Bear With Me
Court of Stars - The Prince of Frost

54911.name: Verschollen in Al'Anfa
54911.description:
Translated from the back of the book:
"Lost in Al'Anfa
You can only break a ring of slave traders if you are courageous enough to explore it from within: as a chained slave!
WARNING! 'Lost in Al'Anfa' is the 'hardest' adventure so far for Das Schwarze Auge. New warriors should keep their hands off, for only shrewd and hardened veterans will stand a chance. Cleverness and tenacity are demanded - and will be awarded with more experience points than ever before."

Additional user summary
